p: There are several factors that initiate the formation of metallic lithium on the surface of the anode electrode, some of these include: (1) the nature of the electrolyte ( i.e., electrolyte formulations with high EC content exhibit lithium plating); (2) the ratio between anode and cathode capacities ( i.e., low anode/capacity ratio will polarize the anode and promote lithium plating); (3) the operating temperature and the charge rate [ i.e., low temperature (−20 °C) and high charge rate] all influence plating on the anode [ 81, 83]. These factors affect the anode kinetics and the lithium ion diffusion rate, such that lithium plates on the surface of the electrode rather than intercalating into the lattice of the carbon.
